source:
# API Analytics Demo
## Azure Synapse Analytics Demo
https://github.com/aessing/demo-azuresynapse

## Developer
Andre Essing</br>
https://www.andre-essing.de/</br>
https://github.com/aessing</br>
https://twitter.com/aessing</br>
https://www.linkedin.com/in/aessing/

> THIS CODE AND INFORMATION ARE PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND,
> EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE IMPLIED
> WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND/OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

## Set some parameters and do some imports

Can be overriden by Azure Synapse Pipelines

# Parameter Cell: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/synapse-analytics/spark/apache-spark-development-using-notebooks#integrate-a-notebook

# file system where the data is located
container = 'abfss://apianalytics@dlsaesdwhtmp002data.dfs.core.windows.net'

# Name of the file, data and table that should be transformed
table = 'Timeseries'
## Import some libraries and build some variables for internal use

from notebookutils import mssparkutils
from pyspark.sql.types import *
from pyspark.sql.functions import lower, year, month, weekofyear, dayofyear, dayofmonth, dayofweek, concat, lpad, when

# Build some path variables that will help reading and writing data from and to lake
extractedPath = f"{container}/temp/extracted/{table}.txt"
rawPath = f"{container}/raw/{table}.csv"
curatedPath = f"{container}/curated/{table.lower()}.parquet"
## Copy data from temp area to raw area and read the data from the lake
# Copy the data from extracted 7ZIP folder to the RAW area
# Read the data from the RAW area into memory (dataframe)

# Cast the data to the correct / needed data format
curateddf = (df
    .withColumn('Id', df['Id'].cast(IntegerType()))
    .withColumn('TimestampUtc', df['TimestampUtc'].cast(TimestampType()))
    .withColumn('UsageKind', df['UsageKind'].cast(IntegerType()))
    .withColumn('OperationId', df['OperationID'].cast(IntegerType()))
    .withColumn('ServiceId', df['ServiceID'].cast(IntegerType()))
    .withColumn('GeoId', df['GeoID'].cast(IntegerType()))
    .withColumn('CallDurationMillis', df['CallDurationMillis'].cast(IntegerType()))
    .withColumn('CustomerId', df['CustomerID'].cast(IntegerType()))
)

# Added some columns that would come in handy when analyzing the data
curateddf = (curateddf
    # Translate UsageKind from an id to an human readable value
    .withColumn('UsageKindDesc', when(curateddf.UsageKind == 0, 'success')
                                .when(curateddf.UsageKind == 1, 'input validation')
                                .when(curateddf.UsageKind == 2, 'error')
                                .otherwise('not defined'))
    # Add some date columns (could be more), because a data citizen doesn't like to handle timestamps                                
    .withColumn('Year', year(curateddf['TimestampUtc']).cast(IntegerType()))
    .withColumn('Month', month(curateddf['TimestampUtc']).cast(IntegerType()))
    .withColumn('YearMonth', concat( year(curateddf['TimestampUtc']), lpad(month(curateddf['TimestampUtc']), 2, '0')).cast(IntegerType()))
    .withColumn('WeekOfYear', weekofyear(curateddf['TimestampUtc']).cast(IntegerType()))
    .withColumn('DayOfYear', dayofyear(curateddf['TimestampUtc']).cast(IntegerType()))
    .withColumn('DayOfMonth', dayofmonth(curateddf['TimestampUtc']).cast(IntegerType()))
    .withColumn('DayOfWeek', dayofweek(curateddf['TimestampUtc']).cast(IntegerType()))
## Writed curated data back to the data lake
# Write the transformed data to the CURATED area in the data lake
